xstream

Class TimeSeriesBuilder

extends Object
    A builder for timeseries.
    Author:
    pinaki poddar

    • Method Detail

      • withSeriesURL

        public TimeSeriesBuilder withSeriesURL(String url)
        sets URL for the timeseries.
        Parameters:
        url - URL defines name and location timeseries The name follows a typical HTTP URL syntax where the path specify store name and series name is consecutive segments. For example, nosql://localhost:5000/mystore/myseries
        Returns:
        this same builder.

      • withFieldDefinitions

        public TimeSeriesBuilder withFieldDefinitions(String... defs)
        Declares the event fields of a timeseries. Each field of an event is described in same syntax of a database column. At minimum, a field is described as name db-type where name is the name of an event property and db-type is moniker of a database type such as integer, string etc.
        Field definitions are mandatory when a new series is created. They are optional to openForRead() or openForWrite() an existing timeseries. If they are specified then they are used to match existing definition.
        Parameters:
        defs - one or more field definitions. Must be specified for creating a series. Can be null for opening existing series.
        Returns:
        this same builder.

      • withSlotEventLimit

        public TimeSeriesBuilder withSlotEventLimit(int l)
        Declares number of events in a time slot in a time series. Each time slot in a time series carries same number of events, though each event need not contain same fields. Slot event limit is used to create a timeseries. The slot event limit, if specified with a positive number, is used to verify the value with while openForRead() or openForWrite() an existing timeseries.
        Parameters:
        l - number of events per slot. Must be greater than zero for creating a series. Can be less than zero to open existing series.
        Returns:
        this same builder.

      • openForWrite

        public WritableTimeSeries openForWrite()
        Opens an existing timeseries to write more events. The events are added at the end of the series.
        Returns:
        a series for new events be written at the end.

      • create

        public WritableTimeSeries create()
        Creates a writable timeseries.
        Returns:
        a writable timeseries.

      • getOrCreate

        public TimeSeries getOrCreate(boolean forRead)

      • openForRead

        public ReadableTimeSeries openForRead()
        Opens a timeseries to read.
        Returns:
        a readable timeseries.
